name: py-ipython
description:
IPython provides a rich toolkit to help you make the most out of using
Python interactively.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-jedi
dependencies.description: An autocompletion tool for Python that can be used for text editors.

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-prompt-toolkit
dependencies.description: Library for building powerful interactive command lines in Python

dependencies.name: py-pygments
dependencies.description: Pygments is a syntax highlighting package written in Python.

dependencies.name: py-backcall
dependencies.description: Specifications for callback functions passed in to an API

dependencies.name: py-pexpect
dependencies.description: Pexpect allows easy control of interactive console applications.

dependencies.name: py-appnope
dependencies.description: Disable App Nap on OS X 10.9

dependencies.name: py-backports-shutil-get-terminal-size
dependencies.description: A backport of the get_terminal_size function from Python 3.3's shutil.

dependencies.name: py-simplegeneric
dependencies.description:
Simple generic functions (similar to Python's own len(), pickle.dump(),
etc.)

dependent_to.name: py-ipdb
dependent_to.description:
ipdb is the iPython debugger and has many additional features, including
a better interactive debugging experience via colorized output.

dependent_to.name: callflow
dependent_to.description:
CallFlow is an interactive visual analysis tool that provides a high-
level overview of CCTs together with semantic refinement operations to
progressively explore the CCTs.

dependent_to.name: py-jupyterlab
dependent_to.description:
JupyterLab is the next-generation web-based user interface for Project
Jupyter.

dependent_to.name: py-spatialist
dependent_to.description:
This package offers functionalities for user-friendly geo data
processing using GDAL and OGR.

dependent_to.name: py-ipyparallel
dependent_to.description: IPython's architecture for parallel and distributed computing.

dependent_to.name: py-ipywidgets
dependent_to.description: IPython widgets for the Jupyter Notebook

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-mixedhtseq
dependent_to.description: HTSeq for mixed single and paired end reads

dependent_to.name: py-ipython-cluster-helper
dependent_to.description:
Quickly and easily parallelize Python functions using IPython on a
cluster, supporting multiple schedulers. Optimizes IPython defaults to
handle larger clusters and simultaneous processes.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-brian2
dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks

dependent_to.name: py-openmc
dependent_to.description:
The OpenMC project aims to provide a fully-featured Monte Carlo particle
transport code based on modern methods. It is a constructive solid
geometry, continuous-energy transport code that uses ACE format cross
sections. The project started under the Computational Reactor Physics
Group at MIT.
